p: Colorectal cancer cells express constitutively active STAT3 [ 27]. Upon exposing tumor cells to various concentrations of essential oils, prepared cell lysates were investigated for the phosphorylation of STAT3 (Tyr 705) and (Ser 727) and performed by western blot analysis. Interestingly, these results show the concentration- and time-dependent repression of STAT-3 activation induced by TA-1 in HCT-116 cells (Figure 5 (Aiv, Biv)). The maximum inhibitory activity occurred at 100 pg/mL, and the optimum time for the repression of STAT3 phosphorylation was at 24 h.
